name: Bintan Lagoon Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ok, so to start off, our expectations weren't all that high to begin with.
reviews.title: Just red flagging - quality control

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We'd been to Bintan Lagoon before and knew what to expect.
reviews.title: Nice Resort with few flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simple, functional, very serviceable, great for families with kids.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort with an amazing pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: That was what we thought until we checked into a suite (the forest suite is not refurbished) and summarily found ourselves in a dump. The bathroom handle was hanging dangerously off its hinges. The air-conditioning in BOTH rooms were broken. Drawers were stuck and handles missing. There was a puddle slowly forming on the bathroom floor because of a leak.
reviews.title: Enter at own risk!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: So a few calls were made and the technician arrives and spends the better part of the day with us.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort for the Family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had a horrible experience at the Bintan Lagoon Resort. Our bathroom was not operational for the 2 days we stayed because of a serious problem with the toilet. It clogged and overflowed 4 times in 2 days. We called for an "engineer" to come 4 times to our room, each time it was "fixed". The next time someone flushed the toilet, it would overflow all over the bathroom- disgusting! When I asked for housekeeping to come and clean the floor (obviously!) they didn't send them for hours and when they came, they used our bath towels to mop up- we had to tell them to go get some cleansers and disinfectants and do a proper job. Needless to say, it was a disgusting and hassle-ridden stay. I voiced my disappointment (anger!) many times and was told that a manager would meet me at checkout to apologize for the awful experience. When I got to the checkout counter, I was told that the manager was having lunch with some other guests and couldn't meet me. After pressing the manager was reached by telephone and I was offered a 10% credit- $58- for my troubles. Seriously? I stayed for 2 days in an unhygenic room with no operational toilet and they offer me a 10% discount? Poor toilet facilites, poor maintenance, poor housekeeping but most of all horrible customer service! This place is a pit!
reviews.title: Do not stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: visited bintan with my partner and 2 other friends, me and my partner decided to book this hotel even thu it cost about a hundred sing more than the other hotel that my friends booked, thinking it would be better. the check counters are under staffed it take me more than 30mins to check in.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: oh well, i'll say I have no problems with bugs in my room like what other ppl mentioned.
reviews.title: need to improve service in restaurants ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm quite excited to see my room my it left me in disappointment, i booked for a deluxe sea view room but i see nothing, half of my view blocked by the building's pillar.
reviews.title: Great 1st Anniversary Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room is always freezing... the temp control dont seem to work. there are black foot print marks on the bed sheets at the side of the bed. : o ( i wonder if they change the sheets.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This Indonesian resort is a quick and popular getaway from Singapore. For a person like me who did not have any place of interest in Singapore, this was heaven. By the side of a private and clean beach, this resort is ideal for family vacations(of course the romantic duos can also have chilling moments here too). The kid-activities are plenty, therefore it takes care of the kids for the entire day. The adults can participate in the other sea or land adventures or indoor/outdoor activities or could relax in the pool or sea and feel the freshness of the weather of Bintan.
reviews.title: Fantabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is great at their Japanese restaurant and at the 3 degree, the restaurant by the beach.
reviews.title: Nice place, but noisy due to construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The spa was also very good and massage was awesome! They just knew the exact moves.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is huge and tastefully done. They keep it clean and the staff is friendly and eager to help.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous, definitely coming back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The souvenir shops were quite reasonable. The activity teachers were quite good(better than the ones that I have encountered at other adventure sports resorts in India).
reviews.title: Probably the worst 3 star hotel ever - Its criminal they even claim 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: While the beach is great, and staff of the resort very friendly, the "monopoly character" of this resort is very disappointing: prices of simple things are extremely high, even compared to SIngapore. For example: a 5-10 minutes taxi from the hotel would cost you SGD 24 per trip, while same trip would cost SGD 7-9 in SIngapore! I was told, that the owner is Singaporean, while the Indonesian staff do understand that such prices are unreasonable! Also, good to know, that the lounge is pretty smelly when shrimps or eggs are fried in the restaurant. For vegetarians, be aware: not much to eat, except some Indian dishes; prices won't go down because vegetable dishes are cheaper....during weekends, be aware that you will need to que for breakfast...long waiting times and tables you would not want for a holiday break. It is a bit of a lousy market place. You will need to be patient if you want your room to be cleaned, or an extra bed to be arranged; it can take 7-8 hours!
reviews.title: Unnecessary high prices milking visitors!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is great! But then a body board would cost SGD 13 for one hour, while at Shangrila in Kota Kinabalu it would be FREE!
reviews.title: Enjoyable trip but more could be improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the owners or management of this resort do not care for their guest, but just for their money!
reviews.title: Nice place for a quick getaway from Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Outdoor adventure is poor.
reviews.title: Michelin star Pricing, Prison style food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this establishment during end october, I booked a deluxe sea facing room and I must say the room was nicely decorated along with a day bed which is good for me and my partner for reading. They had 2 pools, the main and the secondary, you can find most people sun tanning in the main pool which of course had a pool bar which you can savour your food or tropical drinks while sun tanning (I love this!). In summary, a very much enjoyable resort with adequate facilities but unreasonable price if you will have to dine there. A meal for 2 could easily cost you 50-80 SGD. I would recommend the management to revise the prices for sea activities, I notice alot of equipments were left unrented, the mgt could actually revise the price so that more people can afford. Enjoyable resort with very courteous staff, I would only recommend to those with deep pockets.
reviews.title: Great for a golf weekend. Food and beverages terribly overpriced.

description: Perched on the magnificent Pasir Panjang Beach, overlooking the South China Sea, Bintan Lagoon Resort is a tropical haven, home to sun, sea, and two spectacular golf courses.This Indonesian-style resort sprawls over 310 hectares, with a private golden sand beach that stretches 1.5 km. What sets this iconic resort apart from the rest is a private ferry terminal, landing directly at the resort’s doorstep.Whether it is a romantic spa-indulged getaway, a midweek game of golf, or a company event by the ocean, Bintan Lagoon Resort is sure to impress.
